page.title: 02N Woolwich & Ferry 2
page.content: Many families still have to struggle but efforts are being made especially in changing the pattern of housing. A community spirit is developing. People moving from high rise flats to own houses appreciate the improved circumstances. Schools use Woolwich free ferry quite a bit because few open spaces are within easy reach. North Woolwich British Rail station has been converted into a rail museum. The ticket office and other buildings are full of memoribilia and there is a working steam engine which operates most Sundays. The Royal Victoria Gardens is a well established park with a recreation area and people enjoy watching the boats on the river.
